page.title: 04ALSCOTT FARM
page.content: Consists of 177 acres. Main enterprise is beef and sheep run by father and elder son. 70 acres of silage were harvested this year and a few acres of hay. Eight acres of barley is grown for winter feeding to sheep and calves The farm supports a family of 5. Younger son goes out to work. Some seasonal labour is required at Harvest time. Artificial fertilizers are used and chemical sprays for weed control. Stock is sold at Hatherleigh and Holsworthy markets, and some by dead weight to abbatoirs. A public bridleway goes through the farm. There is 10 acres of woodland, mainly oak. The farm has had an Agricultural Museum open to the public for the past ten years. There are early tractors, horse drawn implements, barn machinery and a dairy and domestic section.
